ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a tremendous amount about the Yiddish language, Yiddish and Jewish culture, and modern Hasidic culture
I learned Yiddish grammar, including past and future tense, adjective endings, and time expressions, among other skills. We also learned about Yiddish literature and modern Hasidic culture.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Josh is an incredible teacher. Class is fast-paced, efficient, and focused, and also incredibly fun and funny. I am astonished at how much I've learned in such a short time. As much as I appreciated the take home assessments, I wonder if there could also be some traditional in class assessments, or some more oral assessments (maybe group oral). The questions on the take home assessments included free compositions, which I appreciated, but perhaps a bit more rote memorization of vocabulary (although not too much) could help more with retention.

The strongest part of this course is the instructor, Josh Price. He ensured that the class would gel by incorporating the students into the lessons (in example sentences, e.g.) and encouraging student creativity by assigning poetry and story writing. He also provided very timely feedback and brought in sources from the Yiddish-speaking community. The small class size allowed us to form a tight-knit group that would practice outside of class. The class is well-paced and interesting. It is much better in person than online. One improvement could be to assign less homework daily or to have a break day from homework once a week, though assignments seemed to be more balanced by the end of the semester.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely. Learning Yiddish has been a fulfilling and moving experience and Josh is such an incredible teacher. You learn so much, but there isn't too much work. The class is most of all absolutely hilarious. Yiddish is a beautiful, emotive, and hilarious language.

I would absolutely recommend this course to another student. Aside from opening up a whole new world of literature and art, the course drives creativity and causes you to think critically about structures of gender, class, race, and religion in a productive and meaningful way. The students can tailor the experience to their own interests because the assignments allow a lot of freedom while still teaching the relevant grammatical and linguistic concepts. And it is SO MUCH FUN!

TAKE YIDDISH!! It is such an amazing language, such an amazing way to connect to Jewish culture and history, and such an amazing class. Josh Price is the funniest and just generally one of the best people I know. Take yiddish take yiddish take yiddish
